717340f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 21st Street
717340f-a.text:
View of the north wall of 913 Broadway, adjoining the S.W. corner
of 21st Street. The adjoining building, 915, has just been demolished
but the corner lot, 917-919, has been vacant since 1916.
November 26, 1924.
Dderwood \&: Underwood.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717346f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 21st Street
717346f-b.text:
Broadway, north from 21st Street. In the centre is the Fuller,
or Flatiron Building, whose towering height of 21 stories once
astounded New York and its visitors. Above the Fuller Building is
the Fifth Avenue Building, on the site of the Fifth Avenue Hotel.
The next two loft buildings replaced the Albemarle and the Hoffman
House.
1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.

717343f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 21st Street
717343f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, north from 21st Street. The entire two
blocks in the foreground, from 21st to 23rd Streets, will be un-
changed some twenty-seven years later, in 1936, except for a 12-
story loft building, which will occupy the clearing shown here in
the block between 21st and 22nd Streets. This clearing is the
result of the demolition of three four-story houses. In 1936 the
Bancroft House will be the Hotel Courte; and the Hotel Bartholdi,
on the S.E. corner of 23rd Street, will be the Bartholdi Building,
remodelled into an office building. But during this period of
twenty-seven years there will be no demolitions and, with the ex-
ception noted, no construction work -- a long period in New York.
April, 1909.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
